value.title: Welcome and Course Introduction | Power BI Developer in a Day
value.excerpt: In this video, Peter Myers (Microsoft Most Valued Professional - Data Platform, and course developer), Sergei Gundorov (Principal Program Manager), and Amit Shuster (Product Manager) welcome and introduce you to the course. This is video 1 of 20.    The Power BI Developer in a Day online course empowers you as an

value.title: Computing a running total in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a running total over a dimension, like for example the date. Article and download: https://sql.bi/79926

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: #2 DAX Fridays! 101: Introduction to filter and row context
value.excerpt: Are you new to DAX and want to learn what those things called filter context and row context are? I will attempt to do just that in today's video. Let me know how I did in the comments :) #dax #powerbi #daxfridays #curbal  Happy friday!  DAX 101 playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDz00l_jz6zwdC_xdTp_QANkHYIzs1BJG&disable_polymer=true

value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: Change column names dynamically with parameters in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have released my first template app which is Free to download here: http://bit.ly/2othNWm and one trick I use is to change column names based on parameters given by the end user. Check this video if you want to do that to. :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query, the right way.
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  Link to the null, blank video mentioned in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EoRjNx1G2g4

value.title: DAX Fridays! #81: CALCULATETABLE
value.excerpt: In todays video we are going to cover the DAX function CALCULATETABLE.  CALCULATETABLE allows you to create virtual tables that you can then filter using multiple conditions and use that table to make further calculations.   What is the difference between CALCULATETABLE and CALCULATE?  The first one

value.title: Explain the different types of join/merge available in Power BI/ Excel
value.excerpt: Confused with all the join/ merge types options available in Power BI Desktop? No  worries, we explain all types in detail here. value.title: Fill down and replace null/blank values in Power Query
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to troubleshoot fill down and replace blank values.  If you are trying to fill down blank values or replace null values you might see that power query ignores it completely. In this video I will show you how to fix this issues. value.title: Managing changing column names in Power Query #10: (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show how to manage column headers that changes names so your power bi file does not break when you refresh it.  This tip is from Lars Schreiber and here is the link to his blog post and how to do this in power query: http://power-bi-usergroup.blogspot.se/2015/12/dealing-with-tables-with-changing.html

value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Schedule data downloads / exports in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can export data or download data out of Power BI in many different ways and depending on the source, you can schedule refresh those data dumps too.   In this video, I will give you one example on how to do that.  Other resources mentioned in this video: Export data with DAX Studio: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Gfgnk6R0Qw

value.title: Debug DAX using Variables in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Marco Russo, from SQL BI, joins Patrick to look at how you can debug DAX using variables in Power BI. value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful
